pageContext.claim: “I would say that it's cost me anywhere from $2 [Billion] to $5 billion to be President -- and that’s okay -- between what I lose and what I could have made.”
pageContext.analysis:
There is no evidence for nor any way to verify Trump's estimate that he is losing anywhere from $3 billion to $5 billion as president. Trump once admitted in a legal deposition that he sometimes gives estimates of his financial condition based on gut feeling. Trump's net worth is estimated to be about $3 billion. It's highly unlikely being president will cost him more than his net worth -- and he could well profit from it, since he and his family often blur the line between official actions and private business interests, and because he has refused to divest from his business.
"
